content: The Act may be cited as the "Agricultural Energy Programs Reauthorization Act of 2017". The Act includes a section on the Biobased Markets Program. Section 9002 of the Farm Security and Rural Investment Act of 2002 is amended to include renewable chemicals in the biobased products labeling program. The Secretary will provide education and outreach to stakeholders regarding the voluntary labeling program. The Secretary will provide education and outreach to stakeholders regarding the voluntary labeling program for renewable chemicals and biobased products. The Secretary and the Secretary of Commerce will jointly develop NAICS codes for manufacturers of renewable chemicals and biobased products. The Secretary will develop a national testing center registry for biobased products manufacturers. Amendments include reporting on the quantity of biobased products procured and increasing funding to $6,000,000 for fiscal years 2019 through 2023. The Secretary will establish a national testing center registry for biobased products manufacturers and increase funding to $6,000,000 for fiscal years 2019 through 2023. Amendments also include expanding the definition of biobased products to include those produced from biologically captured and reused carbon. SEC. 3. BIOREFINERY, RENEWABLE CHEMICAL, AND BIOBASED PRODUCT MANUFACTURING ASSISTANCE. Section 9003 of the Farm Security and Rural Investment Act of 2002 is amended to include renewable chemical or biobased product technology in biorefineries, with mandatory funding for loan guarantees under this section. The Farm Security and Rural Investment Act of 2002 is amended to include renewable chemical or biobased product technology in biorefineries. The Secretary will use $75,000,000 annually from 2019 to 2023 for loan guarantees under this section. SEC. 4 of the Farm Security and Rural Investment Act of 2002 is amended to allocate $5,000,000 annually for advanced biofuels from 2018 to 2023. SEC. 5 introduces the Rural Energy for America Program. The definition of a renewable energy system is amended to include components necessary for energy distribution and ancillary infrastructure such as storage systems. The funding for renewable energy systems under the Farm Security and Rural Investment Act of 2002 is increased to $150,000,000 for each fiscal year from 2018 to 2023. Additionally, the allocation of funding is limited to not more than 30 percent for each fiscal year. The funding for renewable energy systems is increased to $150,000,000 annually from 2018 to 2023. Not more than 30 percent of the funding can be used for specific renewable energy forms or energy efficiency technologies.
